The four kinds of deeds [an4.236:5.3]: Dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results
Neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds
Someone murders their mother or father or a perfected one
They maliciously shed the blood of a Realized One
They cause a schism in the Saṅgha
Bright deeds with bright results (a caus: They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical
They’re content, kind-hearted, with right view
Dark and bright deeds with dark and brig: Someone makes both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind
Neither dark nor bright deeds with neith: The intention to give up dark deeds with dark results
The intention to give up bright deeds with bright results
The intention to give up both dark and bright deeds with both dark and bright results
